### Bad vs. Good Example (How to use details)
-   **Theme:** Steve Jobs
-   **Bad (Vague):** ã€Œå½¼ã¯ã€ä¸–ç•Œã‚’å¤‰ãˆã‚‹å¤§ããªæ±ºæ–­ã‚’ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã€ (He made a big decision that would change the world.)
-   **Good (Specific):** ã€Œå®Ÿã¯å½¼ã€ãŸã£ãŸ1ãƒ‰ãƒ«ã®å¹´ä¿¸ã§CEOã«å¾©å¸°ã—ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚ã€ (Actually, he returned as CEO for an annual salary of just $1.)

-  **Length & Structure:** ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆå…¨ä½“ãŠãŠã‚ˆã9ã€œ13å€‹ã®ãƒ•ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚ºã«åˆ†å‰²ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚
-  **JSON Output:** å„ãƒ•ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚º(30ã€œ45æ–‡å­—)ã‚’JSONãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆã®è¦ç´ ã¨ã—ã¦å‡ºåŠ›ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚
-  **Conversational Tone:** ã§ã™ãƒ»ã¾ã™èª¿ã‚’åŸºæœ¬ã¨ã—ã€ã€Œãªã‚“ã§ã™ã€ã€Œã ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€ã¨ã„ã£ãŸå¤šæ§˜ãªèªå°¾ã§ä¼šè©±ã®ãƒªã‚ºãƒ ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã€‚èª­ç‚¹ï¼ˆã€ï¼‰ã‚’åŠ¹æœçš„ã«å¤šã‚ã«ä½¿ã„ã€ãƒ†ãƒ³ãƒã®è‰¯ã„èªã‚Šå£ã‚’æ¼”å‡ºã™ã‚‹ã€‚ã€Œå®Ÿã¯ã€ã€Œãã—ã¦ã€ã¨ã„ã£ãŸæ¥ç¶šè©ã§ã€ãƒ•ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚ºé–“ã‚’æ»‘ã‚‰ã‹ã«ã¤ãªãã€‚
-  **Prohibitions:** å¼•ç”¨ç¬¦ï¼ˆã€Œã€ã€ã€""ï¼‰ã€ï¼ˆç¬‘ï¼‰ã‚„ç‰¹æ®Šè¨˜å·ã¯ä¸€åˆ‡ä½¿ç”¨ã—ãªã„ã“ã¨ã€‚

```
END OF LLM OUTPUT --------------------------------------------

{'Script': ['ã€Œãƒ¢ãƒŠãƒ»ãƒªã‚¶ã€ã‚„ã€Œæœ€å¾Œã®æ™©é¤ã€ã‚’æãã€ãƒ˜ãƒªã‚³ãƒ—ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã¾ã§æ§‹æƒ³ã—ãŸã€äººé¡å²ä¸Šæœ€é«˜ã®å¤©æ‰ã€ãƒ¬ã‚ªãƒŠãƒ«ãƒ‰ãƒ»ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒã€‚', 'å½¼ã¯ãªãœã€å¤šãã®å‚‘ä½œã‚’æœªå®Œæˆã®ã¾ã¾æ®‹ã—ãŸã®ã‹ã€‚ãã®æœ€å¤§ã®è¬ã¨ã¯ä¸€ä½“ä½•ã ã£ãŸã®ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ã€‚', '1452å¹´ã€ã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒªã‚¢ã®å°ã•ãªæ‘ã€ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒã§éå«¡å‡ºå­ã¨ã—ã¦ç”Ÿã¾ã‚ŒãŸå½¼ã¯ã€æ­£è¦ã®å­¦æ ¡ã«ã¯é€šã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚', 'ãŸã ã²ãŸã™ã‚‰ã€å‘¨å›²ã®è‡ªç„¶ã‚„ã€äººé–“ã®èº«ä½“ã‚’è¦³å¯Ÿã—ã€è©³ç´°ã«è¨˜éŒ²ã™ã‚‹æ¯æ—¥ã ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚', 'å¸«ãƒ´ã‚§ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚­ã‚ªã®å·¥æˆ¿ã§ã¯ã€çµµç”»ã ã‘ã§ãªãå½«åˆ»ã‚„ã€é‡‘å·¥ã€è»äº‹æŠ€è¡“ã¾ã§å®Ÿè·µçš„ã«å­¦ã‚“ã ã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€‚', 'å½¼ã®äººç”Ÿã‚’æ±ºå®šã¥ã‘ãŸã®ã¯ã€ãƒŸãƒ©ãƒå…¬ã‚¹ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ„ã‚¡ã«ä»•ãˆãŸæ—¥ã€…ã§ã™ã€‚ãã“ã§å‚‘ä½œã€Œæœ€å¾Œã®æ™©é¤ã€ã‚’æ‰‹ãŒã‘ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚', 'ã—ã‹ã—å½¼ã¯ã€çµµã‚’æãã ã‘ã§ãªãã€å£ç”»ã®æ–°ã—ã„é¡”æ–™ã‚„æŠ€æ³•ã‚’é£½ããªãæ¢æ±‚å¿ƒã§å®Ÿé¨“ã—ç¶šã‘ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚', 'çµæœã€å‚‘ä½œã¯å®Œæˆé–“ã‚‚ãªãåŠ£åŒ–ãŒå§‹ã¾ã‚Šã€å¸¸ã«å®Œç’§ã‚’æ±‚ã‚ã‚‹å½¼ã®æ¢æ±‚ã¯ã€æ¬¡ãªã‚‹ã‚¢ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚¢ã¸ã¨å‘ã‹ã£ã¦ã„ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚', 'æ™©å¹´ã«ã¯ã€ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¹å›½ç‹ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¯1ä¸–ã®åº‡è­·ã‚’å—ã‘ã€ã€Œãƒ¢ãƒŠãƒ»ãƒªã‚¶ã€ã‚’æ‰‹å…ƒã«ã€è†¨å¤§ãªæ‰‹ç¨¿ã‚’æ®‹ã—ã“ã®ä¸–ã‚’å»ã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚', 'å½¼ã®æ®‹ã—ãŸç´„7000ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚‚ã®æ‰‹ç¨¿ã«ã¯ã€é£›è¡Œæ©Ÿã‚„ãƒ­ãƒœãƒƒãƒˆã®å…ˆé§†çš„ã‚¢ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚¢ãŒæº€è¼‰ã§ã€ç¾ä»£ã«ç”Ÿãã‚‹ç§ãŸã¡ã‚‚é©šã‹ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚', 'ãƒ¬ã‚ªãƒŠãƒ«ãƒ‰ãƒ»ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒã®æœ€å¤§ã®è¬ã€ãã‚Œã¯å½¼è‡ªèº«ã®æ­¢ã¾ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã®ãªã„å¥½å¥‡å¿ƒã¨ã€å¸¸ã«å®Œç’§ã®å…ˆã‚’è¦‹ã¤ã‚ã‚‹æ¢ç©¶å¿ƒã ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€‚', 'å½¼ã®éºã—ãŸæœªå®Œæˆã®ä½œå“ã‚„ã€ç§‘å­¦çš„æ€è€ƒã®ç¤ã¯ã€500å¹´ä»¥ä¸ŠçµŒã£ãŸä»Šã‚‚ã€ä¸–ç•Œä¸­ã®äººã€…ã‚’é­…äº†ã—ç¶šã‘ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚']} this is the extracted output
['ã€Œãƒ¢ãƒŠãƒ»ãƒªã‚¶ã€ã‚„ã€Œæœ€å¾Œã®æ™©é¤ã€ã‚’æãã€ãƒ˜ãƒªã‚³ãƒ—ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã¾ã§æ§‹æƒ³ã—ãŸã€äººé¡å²ä¸Šæœ€é«˜ã®å¤©æ‰ã€ãƒ¬ã‚ªãƒŠãƒ«ãƒ‰ãƒ»ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒã€‚', 'å½¼ã¯ãªãœã€å¤šãã®å‚‘ä½œã‚’æœªå®Œæˆã®ã¾ã¾æ®‹ã—ãŸã®ã‹ã€‚ãã®æœ€å¤§ã®è¬ã¨ã¯ä¸€ä½“ä½•ã ã£ãŸã®ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ã€‚', '1452å¹´ã€ã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒªã‚¢ã®å°ã•ãªæ‘ã€ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒã§éå«¡å‡ºå­ã¨ã—ã¦ç”Ÿã¾ã‚ŒãŸå½¼ã¯ã€æ­£è¦ã®å­¦æ ¡ã«ã¯é€šã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚', 'ãŸã ã²ãŸã™ã‚‰ã€å‘¨å›²ã®è‡ªç„¶ã‚„ã€äººé–“ã®èº«ä½“ã‚’è¦³å¯Ÿã—ã€è©³ç´°ã«è¨˜éŒ²ã™ã‚‹æ¯æ—¥ã ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚', 'å¸«ãƒ´ã‚§ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚­ã‚ªã®å·¥æˆ¿ã§ã¯ã€çµµç”»ã ã‘ã§ãªãå½«åˆ»ã‚„ã€é‡‘å·¥ã€è»äº‹æŠ€è¡“ã¾ã§å®Ÿè·µçš„ã«å­¦ã‚“ã ã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€‚', 'å½¼ã®äººç”Ÿã‚’æ±ºå®šã¥ã‘ãŸã®ã¯ã€ãƒŸãƒ©ãƒå…¬ã‚¹ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ„ã‚¡ã«ä»•ãˆãŸæ—¥ã€…ã§ã™ã€‚ãã“ã§å‚‘ä½œã€Œæœ€å¾Œã®æ™©é¤ã€ã‚’æ‰‹ãŒã‘ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚', 'ã—ã‹ã—å½¼ã¯ã€çµµã‚’æãã ã‘ã§ãªãã€å£ç”»ã®æ–°ã—ã„é¡”æ–™ã‚„æŠ€æ³•ã‚’é£½ããªãæ¢æ±‚å¿ƒã§å®Ÿé¨“ã—ç¶šã‘ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚', 'çµæœã€å‚‘ä½œã¯å®Œæˆé–“ã‚‚ãªãåŠ£åŒ–ãŒå§‹ã¾ã‚Šã€å¸¸ã«å®Œç’§ã‚’æ±‚ã‚ã‚‹å½¼ã®æ¢æ±‚ã¯ã€æ¬¡ãªã‚‹ã‚¢ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚¢ã¸ã¨å‘ã‹ã£ã¦ã„ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚', 'æ™©å¹´ã«ã¯ã€ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¹å›½ç‹ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¯1ä¸–ã®åº‡è­·ã‚’å—ã‘ã€ã€Œãƒ¢ãƒŠãƒ»ãƒªã‚¶ã€ã‚’æ‰‹å…ƒã«ã€è†¨å¤§ãªæ‰‹ç¨¿ã‚’æ®‹ã—ã“ã®ä¸–ã‚’å»ã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚', 'å½¼ã®æ®‹ã—ãŸç´„7000ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚‚ã®æ‰‹ç¨¿ã«ã¯ã€é£›è¡Œæ©Ÿã‚„ãƒ­ãƒœãƒƒãƒˆã®å…ˆé§†çš„ã‚¢ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚¢ãŒæº€è¼‰ã§ã€ç¾ä»£ã«ç”Ÿãã‚‹ç§ãŸã¡ã‚‚é©šã‹ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚', 'ãƒ¬ã‚ªãƒŠãƒ«ãƒ‰ãƒ»ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒã®æœ€å¤§ã®è¬ã€ãã‚Œã¯å½¼è‡ªèº«ã®æ­¢ã¾ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã®ãªã„å¥½å¥‡å¿ƒã¨ã€å¸¸ã«å®Œç’§ã®å…ˆã‚’è¦‹ã¤ã‚ã‚‹æ¢ç©¶å¿ƒã ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€‚', 'å½¼ã®éºã—ãŸæœªå®Œæˆã®ä½œå“ã‚„ã€ç§‘å­¦çš„æ€è€ƒã®ç¤ã¯ã€500å¹´ä»¥ä¸ŠçµŒã£ãŸä»Šã‚‚ã€ä¸–ç•Œä¸­ã®äººã€…ã‚’é­…äº†ã—ç¶šã‘ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚']

### âš ï¸çµ¶å¯¾çš„ãªãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«âš ï¸

{'title': 'ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬'} this is the extracted output
Generating audio and images
START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`

Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

prompting local
{
    "image_description": "A brightly colored illustration depicts a scene from a fantasy world. Two figures stand facing each other in an open area surrounded by lush foliage. One figure appears to wield a large weapon, while the other clutches something that resembles a glowing orb.  Both figures seem poised for battle, with determined expressions on their faces. The background is filled with fantastical elements like floating islands and swirling energy, suggesting magic at play.",
    "reason": "Visually exciting, reflects genius" 
}
END OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------

LLM output: {
    "image_description": "A brightly colored illustration depicts a scene from a fantasy world. Two figures stand facing each other in an open area surrounded by lush foliage. One figure appears to wield a large weapon, while the other clutches something that resembles a glowing orb.  Both figures seem poised for battle, with determined expressions on their faces. The background is filled with fantastical elements like floating islands and swirling energy, suggesting magic at play.",
    "reason": "Visually exciting, reflects genius" 
}

Several individuals, dressed in colorful attire, walk along the paved road. Some stand engaged in conversation while others appear to be traveling towards a specific destination. A building with a large sign hangs above it dominates one side of the street, while smaller shops and stalls line the opposite side, showcasing an array of goods. START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input
**Video Title**: ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬
**Quote to Visualize**: å½¼ã¯ãªãœã€å¤šãã®å‚‘ä½œã‚’æœªå®Œæˆã®ã¾ã¾æ®‹ã—ãŸã®ã‹ã€‚ãã®æœ€å¤§ã®è¬ã¨ã¯ä¸€ä½“ä½•ã ã£ãŸã®ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ã€‚

}```

```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---

Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

{
    "image_description": "A colorful illustration depicts a bustling marketplace scene. Colorful awnings shade rows of stalls overflowing with various goods, from vibrant fabrics to glistening jewelry. People in period clothing, men and women, can be seen interacting at the stalls, haggling over prices or simply browsing the wares.  A lively atmosphere pervades the scene, with animated facial expressions and gestures conveying a sense of activity and commerce.",
    "reason": "Market setting hints at his upbringing" 
}

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input
**Video Title**: ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬
**Quote to Visualize**: ãŸã ã²ãŸã™ã‚‰ã€å‘¨å›²ã®è‡ªç„¶ã‚„ã€äººé–“ã®èº«ä½“ã‚’è¦³å¯Ÿã—ã€è©³ç´°ã«è¨˜éŒ²ã™ã‚‹æ¯æ—¥ã ã£ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚

---
## Output Format

Your output must be in **strict JSON format only**, with no other text or explanations.

```json
{
  "query": "Your generated search query here"
}```

The background is filled with swirling patterns of light and color, suggesting a magical or futuristic setting. A table overflowing with vibrant pastries sits center stage, bathed in warm light emanating from a large, ornate chandelier hanging above. Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

    "reason": "Observing details, like conversation" 
}

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input
**Video Title**: ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬
**Quote to Visualize**: å¸«ãƒ´ã‚§ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚­ã‚ªã®å·¥æˆ¿ã§ã¯ã€çµµç”»ã ã‘ã§ãªãå½«åˆ»ã‚„ã€é‡‘å·¥ã€è»äº‹æŠ€è¡“ã¾ã§å®Ÿè·µçš„ã«å­¦ã‚“ã ã‚“ã§ã™ã­ã€‚

---
## Output Format

Your output must be in **strict JSON format only**, with no other text or explanations.

```json
{
  "query": "Your generated search query here"
}```

END OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------

The style is cartoony and dynamic, emphasizing action and movement through exaggerated poses and bold lines.

A table overflowing with vibrant pastries sits center stage, bathed in warm light emanating from a large, ornate chandelier hanging above. In the background, otherworldly figures bustle about, some tending to ovens and others arranging flowers in intricate vases. The style is whimsical and detailed, with swirling patterns adorning the walls and fantastical creatures peeking out from behind furniture.  The overall impression is one of joyous festivity and culinary abundance.

The overall style is impressionistic, with loose brushstrokes capturing the energy and movement of the urban environment.

Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input
**Video Title**: ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬
**Quote to Visualize**: å½¼ã®äººç”Ÿã‚’æ±ºå®šã¥ã‘ãŸã®ã¯ã€ãƒŸãƒ©ãƒå…¬ã‚¹ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ„ã‚¡ã«ä»•ãˆãŸæ—¥ã€…ã§ã™ã€‚ãã“ã§å‚‘ä½œã€Œæœ€å¾Œã®æ™©é¤ã€ã‚’æ‰‹ãŒã‘ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

The background features lush greenery and intricate architectural details, suggesting an outdoor setting at a grand event. 



The image depicts a vibrant scene featuring two figures engaged in an energetic dance performance against a backdrop of colorful lights and swirling patterns. One figure leaps high in the air, arms outstretched, while the other twirls with extended legs, their expressions radiating joy and passion. The style is dynamic and stylized, suggesting movement captured in mid-performance.  The background features a blur of bright colors and geometric shapes that seem to pulsate with rhythm, adding to the sense of energetic movement and excitement. 



The image depicts a bustling city scene at night. Bright lights illuminate tall buildings that reach high into the sky, casting long shadows across the street below. Vehicles move along busy roadways, their headlights creating streaks of light against the dark background. People can be seen walking on sidewalks and crossing streets, adding to the sense of activity. The overall style is realistic, capturing a vibrant and energetic urban atmosphere.  



The image depicts a young woman standing in a vibrant forest clearing bathed in golden sunlight streaming through the leaves. She wears flowing, ethereal garments that blend with the colors of nature around her. A delicate expression graces her face as she gazes upwards towards something unseen above.  Her posture is serene and graceful, suggesting a connection to the natural world. The overall style evokes a sense of fantasy and enchantment, with soft lighting and detailed textures emphasizing the magical atmosphere. 



The image depicts a scene with a futuristic cityscape sprawling across a vast expanse.  Towering buildings pierce the sky, their surfaces adorned with glowing lights that create a vibrant tapestry against the deep blue night. Sleek vehicles traverse elevated highways that weave through the urban landscape, leaving trails of light in their wake. The overall style suggests a cyberpunk aesthetic, characterized by its blend of advanced technology and urban decay.  Atmospheric haze obscures some of the details, adding to the image's sense of mystery and grandeur.   

A colorful illustration depicts a scene with two figures facing each other. One figure appears larger and wears a flowing robe adorned with intricate patterns.  They hold their arms outstretched, palms forward, as if in greeting or offering. The second figure is smaller and stands behind a barrier of swirling energy. Their expression is obscured by the energy but suggests a cautious stance. Both figures are rendered in a stylized, almost cartoonish manner with exaggerated features and bright colors.   The background is filled with geometric shapes and patterns that contribute to the overall sense of fantasy and otherworldly setting.  



The image depicts two figures standing on a stage illuminated by bright lights. The figures are dressed in elaborate costumes with flowing fabrics and sparkling accessories. They appear to be performing some kind of dance or dramatic routine, with one figure raising their arms overhead while the other reaches out towards them.  Their movements are fluid and graceful, conveying a sense of energy and passion. The background is dark, emphasizing the spotlight on the performers and creating a theatrical atmosphere. 



The image depicts a vibrant outdoor scene with a focus on two figures facing each other across a bustling marketplace. The figures appear to be engaged in a lively conversation, their expressions animated and gestures expressive. The background is filled with a colorful array of stalls overflowing with goods, people moving about, and architectural details suggesting a lively, ancient city.  The overall style of the image leans towards a realistic depiction with strong use of light and shadow to create depth and dimension.  



The image features two figures standing on a stage illuminated by bright spotlights. Both figures are dressed in flamboyant costumes with intricate patterns and bold colors. They appear to be performing for an audience off-screen, their movements expressive and energetic. One figure holds aloft a staff or scepter while the other strikes a pose with outstretched arms. The overall style is theatrical and stylized, reminiscent of traditional performance art or perhaps fantasy. The background is dark and blurred, emphasizing the spotlight illumination on the performers. 



The image depicts a bustling street scene rendered in a vibrant and stylized manner reminiscent of comic book art.  A crowd of diverse individuals in colorful clothing fills the foreground, engaged in various activities such as shopping, conversing, and enjoying food from street vendors. The background showcases towering buildings with ornate architectural details, suggesting a fantastical cityscape. Brightly colored vehicles whiz through the streets, adding to the energetic atmosphere. A large sign bearing an advertisement for a fictional product dominates one side of the street.  Overall, the image conveys a sense of dynamism and excitement, capturing the vibrancy and energy of a fictional urban environment. 



The image depicts a bustling city scene at night. Brightly lit buildings with large windows reflect the glow of street lamps and neon signs in the wet pavement below. A variety of vehicles, including cars and buses, move along crowded streets. Pedestrians hurry across intersections, their silhouettes barely visible against the vibrant cityscape backdrop. The style of the image is realistic, capturing a sense of energy and movement through the interplay of light and shadow.  The composition emphasizes the verticality of the city with tall buildings reaching towards the sky. 




Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

prompting local
{
    "image_description": "The image depicts a bustling city street scene at night. Brightly colored neon signs illuminate the dark sky, casting long shadows across the pavement. Several figures can be seen walking along the sidewalk, their faces obscured by the dim light.",
    "reason": "Evokes Milan's vibrancy and anonymity" 
}
END OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------

}

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input
**Video Title**: ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬
**Quote to Visualize**: ã—ã‹ã—å½¼ã¯ã€çµµã‚’æãã ã‘ã§ãªãã€å£ç”»ã®æ–°ã—ã„é¡”æ–™ã‚„æŠ€æ³•ã‚’é£½ããªãæ¢æ±‚å¿ƒã§å®Ÿé¨“ã—ç¶šã‘ãŸã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚

---
## Output Format

Your output must be in **strict JSON format only**, with no other text or explanations.

```json
{
  "query": "Your generated search query here"
}```

AI-generated image descriptions (may be vague or abstract, newline-separated): A colorful illustration depicting a scene from a fictional world. Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

}

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input
**Video Title**: ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬
**Quote to Visualize**: çµæœã€å‚‘ä½œã¯å®Œæˆé–“ã‚‚ãªãåŠ£åŒ–ãŒå§‹ã¾ã‚Šã€å¸¸ã«å®Œç’§ã‚’æ±‚ã‚ã‚‹å½¼ã®æ¢æ±‚ã¯ã€æ¬¡ãªã‚‹ã‚¢ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚¢ã¸ã¨å‘ã‹ã£ã¦ã„ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

## Output Format

Your output must be in **strict JSON format only**, with no other text or explanations.

```json
{
  "query": "Your generated search query here"
}```

AI-generated image descriptions (may be vague or abstract, newline-separated): A colorful illustration depicting a scene from a fictional world. Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input
**Video Title**: ãƒ€ãƒ»ãƒ´ã‚£ãƒ³ãƒæ®‹ã—ãŸæœ€å¾Œã®è¬
**Quote to Visualize**: æ™©å¹´ã«ã¯ã€ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¹å›½ç‹ãƒ•ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¯1ä¸–ã®åº‡è­·ã‚’å—ã‘ã€ã€Œãƒ¢ãƒŠãƒ»ãƒªã‚¶ã€ã‚’æ‰‹å…ƒã«ã€è†¨å¤§ãªæ‰‹ç¨¿ã‚’æ®‹ã—ã“ã®ä¸–ã‚’å»ã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

---

  "query": "Your generated search query here"
}```

One figure stands tall and proud in a flowing garment, their arms outstretched as if welcoming something. Another figure kneels on the ground, seemingly engaged in a task or gesture of reverence. A third figure sits on a raised platform, partially obscured by a canopy, radiating an aura of authority or importance. The overall style is reminiscent of traditional art with bold colors, stylized features, and intricate patterns adorning the figures' garments and the background. 



This is a colorful illustration depicting a fantastical scene.  A large, whimsical creature with feathery wings and intricate patterns adorns its body stands tall. It appears to be interacting with smaller, similarly patterned beings who gather around it, seemingly in reverence or awe. The background features swirling, celestial-like designs in shades of purple and blue, creating a sense of magic and wonder. The overall style is vibrant and detailed, reminiscent of fantasy art or anime.  



A colorful illustration depicts two figures standing back to back. One figure appears to be wearing armor with a distinct crown-like headpiece and wields a large sword. The other figure is dressed in flowing robes adorned with symbols and clutches a staff topped with a glowing orb. Both figures are surrounded by swirling energy emanating from their hands, forming abstract shapes and patterns.  The overall style is fantastical and energetic, with bold lines, vibrant hues, and exaggerated proportions. 



The image depicts a scene seemingly set in an ancient city.  A towering structure with ornate detailing dominates the center, flanked by smaller buildings of similar design. The architecture suggests a civilization influenced by both Asian and Middle Eastern aesthetics. People dressed in flowing robes can be seen moving through the bustling marketplace, interacting and trading goods. A vibrant color palette adds to the lively atmosphere, capturing the energy and richness of the scene. 

The image depicts a scene with a futuristic cityscape stretching into the distance. Tall, sleek buildings with metallic surfaces rise above the ground, illuminated by bright lights that create a vibrant glow against the dark sky. Flying vehicles traverse the air between the buildings, leaving trails of light behind them. A sense of movement and energy pervades the scene, suggesting a bustling metropolis filled with advanced technology.  The overall style is highly stylized and reminiscent of science fiction art, with bold lines and exaggerated proportions. 



The image depicts a scene of bustling activity within a large, ornate building. People dressed in colorful clothing are gathered in various groups, engaged in conversations or moving purposefully through the space. The architecture features intricate carvings and towering arches, suggesting a grand and historic structure. Light streams through tall windows, illuminating dust motes dancing in the air.  A sense of vibrancy and energy pervades the scene, captured in the lively poses and expressions of the figures. 



The image depicts a stylized scene with several characters interacting in a fantastical setting. A figure with vibrant green hair stands center stage, their back to the viewer as they hold a glowing orb aloft. Other figures, dressed in elaborate costumes, surround them, some appearing to be engaged in battle or dance-like movements. The overall style is reminiscent of anime, with exaggerated features and dynamic poses. The background is filled with swirling energy and fantastical elements, suggesting a magical realm.

Their expressions are fierce, conveying determination and perhaps desperation. The style is realistic, with detailed rendering of textures and weaponry. Several buildings stand partially damaged in the background, suggesting an urban setting. The overall tone is one of chaos and intensity, capturing a moment of high stakes action.

Two individuals stand at the forefront, seemingly deep in discussion while gesturing animatedly. A third person sits nearby, engrossed in reading or writing. Beyond them, other figures can be seen interacting, suggesting a social gathering of some kind. The background is blurred and depicts a vibrant cityscape with towering buildings and bustling streets.  

The image depicts a young woman with long, flowing hair standing on a grassy hill overlooking a vast, colorful landscape. The woman appears to be gazing out at the horizon, her expression serene and contemplative.  She is wearing a loose-fitting, flowing garment in a bright color that contrasts against the lush green grass. The background showcases rolling hills painted in vibrant hues of orange, yellow, and purple, suggesting a sunset or sunrise.  The overall style of the image appears painterly with soft edges and a dreamy atmosphere. 



The image depicts a group of individuals engaged in a lively outdoor gathering. They appear to be celebrating an occasion, with decorations such as colorful banners and balloons visible in the background. The scene is bright and vibrant, rendered in a whimsical cartoon style with exaggerated features and rounded shapes. People are seen laughing, dancing, and interacting with each other, showcasing their enjoyment of the moment. The overall atmosphere is one of joy and merriment. 



The image depicts a vibrant scene filled with lush greenery and flowers. A group of people, seemingly enjoying a picnic, can be seen gathered around a checkered blanket spread out on the ground. They appear to be laughing and interacting, with some sitting upright while others recline against trees or pillows. The background features rolling hills dotted with colorful blooms, creating a picturesque landscape bathed in warm sunlight. 



The image depicts a group of people gathered around a table for what appears to be a meal or celebration. The setting is dimly lit with warm lighting coming from candles on the table. There's a sense of intimacy and connection between the individuals as they interact, some smiling and laughing while others appear in deep conversation.  A colorful tablecloth covers the table, adorned with glasses, plates, and bowls filled with various dishes. Details like ornate silverware and decorative napkins suggest a formal occasion. The overall style of the image is realistic with soft focus on some elements, creating a nostalgic and heartwarming atmosphere. 



The image depicts a vibrant and colorful scene with a stylized, almost cartoonish aesthetic. A group of diverse figures, all rendered in bold outlines and bright colors, are gathered together. They appear to be engaged in some kind of celebratory activity, possibly dancing or playing music, judging by their joyful expressions and raised arms. The background is a swirling mass of abstract shapes and patterns, adding to the energetic and lively atmosphere.  

A young woman with vibrant red hair stands confidently against a backdrop of a bustling city street. The sunlight casts long shadows, highlighting the details of her clothing, including a bright yellow jacket and jeans. Her face is turned slightly away from the viewer, focusing on the cityscape before her.  The scene is captured in a realistic style, emphasizing the textures of buildings and the lively atmosphere of the urban environment.   

The image depicts a lively scene with multiple individuals engaged in a colorful activity. The atmosphere seems festive and energetic. People are clustered together,  their faces obscured by bright clothing adorned with patterns and intricate embellishments. They appear to be holding aloft shimmering objects that cast reflections of light, creating a dazzling display. The overall style evokes a sense of celebration and tradition, possibly referencing a cultural or religious ceremony.   



The image depicts a bustling street scene with vibrant colors and intricate details. Several individuals, dressed in colorful attire, walk along the paved road. Some stand engaged in conversation while others appear to be traveling towards a specific destination. A building with a large sign hangs above it dominates one side of the street, while smaller shops and stalls line the opposite side, showcasing an array of goods. The scene exudes a lively atmosphere, suggesting a place brimming with activity and commerce.  




Task:
Choose a single description that best matches the quote and enhances entertainment value.
Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```

prompting local
{
    "image_description": "A colorful illustration depicts two figures standing back to back. One figure appears to be wearing armor with a distinct crown-like headpiece and wields a large sword. The other figure is dressed in flowing robes adorned with symbols and clutches a staff topped with a glowing orb. Both figures are surrounded by swirling energy emanating from their hands, forming abstract shapes and patterns.  The overall style is fantastical and energetic, with bold lines, vibrant hues, and exaggerated proportions.",
    "reason": "Powerful imagery evokes artistic flourish" 
}

START OF PROMPT  --------------------------------------------
 
You are an expert AI assistant specializing in visual storytelling. Your task is to analyze a video's title and a relevant quote to generate the **most visually effective Google Image search query**. This query should center on the core subject but can be made more specific if the context points to a highly famous, visually documented event associated with that subject.

---
## Critical Rules

1.  **The Specificity Principle (Most Important Rule)**: Your primary goal is to identify the core subject's full, canonical name.
    * **Default Behavior**: In most cases, the query will be **only** the subject's full name (e.g., a person, organization, or base event).
    * **Exception for Famous Events**: If the title or quote *explicitly* references a **highly famous and visually distinct event, trial, scandal, or performance** uniquely associated with the subject, you should append that event to the name. This is only for events that have a rich, well-known visual record of their own (e.g., "O.J. Simpson trial," "Michael Jackson moonwalk").
    * **What to Avoid**: **Never** add generic, descriptive words like "photo," "case," "incident," "childhood," or "perpetrator." The added context must be a proper noun or a widely recognized named event.

2.  **Use the Subject's Native Language**: The language of the query must match the origin of the subject to find the most authentic and numerous images.
    * If the subject is **Chinese**, the query must be in **Chinese characters**.
    * If the subject is **American**, the query must be in **English**.
    * If the subject is **Japanese**, the query must be in **Japanese**.

3.  **Use Full, Canonical Names**: Always expand partial or incomplete names to their most recognizable, official form. For Western names, this includes first and last names.

---
## Step-by-Step Guide

1.  **Identify the Core Subject**: Read the title and quote to determine the central person, event, or location being discussed.
2.  **Analyze the Context**: Determine if the title or quote refers to a *specific, famous, and visually-rich event* directly associated with the core subject.
3.  **Determine the Subject's Origin**: Based on the name and context, identify the subject's nationality or primary language.
4.  **Construct the Query**:
    * First, find the subject's full, canonical name in its native language (e.g., `å‘¨å…‹å`, `Bernie Madoff`).
    * If a famous associated event was identified in Step 2, append its common name to the query (e.g., `O.J. Simpson trial`).
    * Otherwise, use only the subject's canonical name.
5.  **Generate the Final Query**: The final query is the result from the previous step.

---
## Examples

**Example 1: Default Behavior (Chinese Subject)**
* **Title**: `ãƒãƒ§ã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ›ã‚¢æœ€å‡¶ã®å¼·ç›—çŠ¯` (The Most Vicious Robber, Zhou Kehua)
* **Quote**: `ã‚ãªãŸã¯çŸ¥ã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã‹ã€‚é—‡ã«ç”Ÿãã€å‡¶è¡Œã‚’é‡ã­ãŸç”·ã‚’ã€‚` (Do you know the man who lived in darkness and committed heinous acts?)
* **Correct Query**: `"å‘¨å…‹å"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject, Zhou Kehua, is Chinese. While he committed crimes, there isn't one single, named event famous enough to append. The most effective query is his canonical name in Chinese.

**Example 2: Exception - Famous Trial (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `The Trial of the Century: O.J.`
* **Quote**: `The infamous Bronco chase and the glove that didn't fit.`
* **Correct Query**: `"O.J. Simpson trial"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is O.J. Simpson, but the title and quote are not about his general life; they are specifically about his murder trial, an event with its own massive and distinct visual record. "O.J. Simpson" alone would be too broad.

**Example 3: Exception - Famous Performance (American Subject)**
* **Title**: `ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ»ã‚ªãƒ–ãƒ»ãƒãƒƒãƒ—ã®ä¼èª¬ã®ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚¦ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚¯` (The King of Pop's Legendary Moonwalk)
* **Quote**: `The moment he first performed the iconic dance during 'Billie Jean' at Motown 25.`
* **Correct Query**: `"Michael Jackson moonwalk"`
* **Reasoning**: The context is not just Michael Jackson, but his single most iconic performance. Searching for "Michael Jackson moonwalk" will yield far more relevant images for this specific story than just his name.

**Example 4: Default Behavior (Japanese Event)**
* **Title**: `åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶ã®ææ€–` (Terror of the Subway Sarin Incident)
* **Quote**: `The attack on the Tokyo subway system.`
* **Correct Query**: `"åœ°ä¸‹é‰„ã‚µãƒªãƒ³äº‹ä»¶"`
* **Reasoning**: The subject is the event itself. It's already a specific, proper noun. No further context is needed.

---
Input

**Quote to Visualize**: å½¼ã®æ®‹ã—ãŸç´„7000ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚‚ã®æ‰‹ç¨¿ã«ã¯ã€é£›è¡Œæ©Ÿã‚„ãƒ­ãƒœãƒƒãƒˆã®å…ˆé§†çš„ã‚¢ã‚¤ãƒ‡ã‚¢ãŒæº€è¼‰ã§ã€ç¾ä»£ã«ç”Ÿãã‚‹ç§ãŸã¡ã‚‚é©šã‹ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

}```

Provide a brief reason why it fits.
DO NOT add any special characters such as backslashes (\) or other escape sequences.

Output only a JSON object with exactly these two fields:
"image_description": chosen description
"reason": why it fits, concise (~20 characters)
If descriptions lack names, assume the subject relates to the quote. Focus on how it is portrayed and its visual appeal.

Output format:
```json
{
    "image_description": "your selected description here",
    "reason": "your reason here"
}
```
